org.openimaj.ml.timeseries.collection

Class SynchronisedTimeSeriesCollection<ALLINPUT,SINGLEINPUT,TIMESERIES extends SynchronisedTimeSeriesCollection<ALLINPUT,SINGLEINPUT,TIMESERIES,INTERNALSERIES>,INTERNALSERIES extends TimeSeries<ALLINPUT,SINGLEINPUT,INTERNALSERIES>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openimaj.ml.timeseries.TimeSeries<Map<String,ALLINPUT>,Map<String,SINGLEINPUT>,TIMESERIES>
      • org.openimaj.ml.timeseries.collection.TimeSeriesCollection<ALLINPUT,SINGLEINPUT,TIMESERIES,INTERNALSERIES>
        • org.openimaj.ml.timeseries.collection.SynchronisedTimeSeriesCollection<ALLINPUT,SINGLEINPUT,TIMESERIES,INTERNALSERIES>
  • Type Parameters:
    ALLINPUT - The collection input type
    SINGLEINPUT - The type of a single time point data
    INTERNALSERIES - The type of the internal series held in this collection
    TIMESERIES -
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<IndependentPair<Long,Map<String,SINGLEINPUT>>>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DoubleSynchronisedTimeSeriesCollection

    public abstract class SynchronisedTimeSeriesCollection<ALLINPUT,SINGLEINPUT,TIMESERIES extends SynchronisedTimeSeriesCollection<ALLINPUT,SINGLEINPUT,TIMESERIES,INTERNALSERIES>,INTERNALSERIES extends TimeSeries<ALLINPUT,SINGLEINPUT,INTERNALSERIES>>
extends TimeSeriesCollection<ALLINPUT,SINGLEINPUT,TIMESERIES,INTERNALSERIES>
    A collection of time series which share exactly the same time steps. Given that this is true, SynchronisedTimeSeriesProcessor instances can perform interesting analysis
    Author:
    Sina Samangooei (ss@ecs.soton.ac.uk)

        public void set(long[] time,
                Map<String,ALLINPUT> data)

        Description copied from class: TimeSeries
        Set the data associated with each time. This function explicitly assumes that time.length == data.length and there exists a single data instance per time instance
